intro: Balaniella distans, commonly known as the slender bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly pubescent surface. Balaniella distans is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
